--- In cantera@yahoogroups.com, "kevinmwalters" <kwalters@...> wrote:
>
> I=
 saw that the Reactor and FlowReactor classes still only have
> isothermal =
and adiabatic options.  I'd like to implement a variable
> T-P model, prefe=
rably through the Python interface.
> 
> Does anyone know of a straightforw=
ard way to implement a variable T-
P
> reactor in Python?  I was thinking a=
bout using the stiff ODE
> integrator in SciPy, but that requires use of Nu=
mPy and might 
conflict
> with Cantera's use of Numarray.  Do you think thi=
s would work, or is
> the Matlab approach below still recommended.
> 
> --K=
evin
 
Hello Kevin,

I started to use Cantera very recently and therefore c=
ould be wrong. 
I hope that David will correct me if I propose something st=
upid. It 
seems for me that the possibility that you are asking for, is pre=
sent 
already in Cantera (probably, with very minor changing). To perform 
=
simulation with given pressure and temperature you can use the 
Reactor cla=
ss and put the volume expansion and heat transfer 
coefficients to very hig=
h values. It will guarantee that the pressure 
and temperature in the react=
or are the same as those of the 
environment. What you only need to do in t=
his case is to provide 
functional dependences for T and P of the reservoir=
. Of course, it is 
not very effective way but in this case you should not =
change 
anything in the Reactor class. 

Best regards, Anatoli.
